item.title: 弗拉基米尔-普京（Vladimir Putin）即将在本周末再任六年总统，预计他将继续乌克兰战争，推出新法律以压制不同政见，并对富人增税。
item.description:
Vladimir Putin, on the cusp of securing another six years as president this weekend, is expected to carry on the war in Ukraine, launch new laws to stifle dissent and increase taxes on the rich https://t.co/YbiCq4x9ME https://t.co/YbiCq4x9ME

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 17, 2024

item.title: 航空公司首席执行官迈克尔-奥利里（Michael O'Leary）今年有望获得 1 亿多美元的奖金。F 炸弹、出言不逊的笑话和醉醺醺的晚餐都是他的口头禅。
item.description:
The airline CEO Michael O’Leary is on course for a $100 million-plus bonus this year. F-bombs, off-color jokes and drunken dinners are all part of his lore. https://t.co/bJlX5IbWdG https://t.co/bJlX5IbWdG

item.title: 在当今的 "勾搭 "文化中，性的竞争环境并不公平，但假装公平却符合男性的利益。路易丝-佩里写道，女性有权愤怒。
item.description:
In today’s hookup culture the sexual playing field is not even, but it suits men’s interests to pretend that it is. Women are entitled to be angry, writes Louise Perry. https://t.co/MC7LAPqhIH https://t.co/MC7LAPqhIH

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 17, 2024

item.title: Kaia Gerber 深知作为 nepo 宝宝的好处。"她说："我个人非常清楚这对我的好处，我绝不会说任何负面的话。

item.title: 巴塞罗那椅伊姆斯休闲椅和长椅。经典，但过于夸张，被无情地淘汰，令人疲倦。是时候考虑一下这些设计师认可的、同样别致的替代品了。
item.description:

item.title: 为了了解 500 万美元在退休生活中能买到什么，我们采访了全国各地拥有这个数字储蓄的退休人员。在这里，他们畅谈了自己的财务生活以及如何花费时间和金钱。
item.description:
To find out what $5 million buys in retirement, we spoke to retirees around the country with savings in that ballpark. Here, they open up about their financial lives and how they spend their time and money. https://t.co/65KcvboRWZ https://t.co/65KcvboRWZ

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 17, 2024

item.title: 由于食品价格不断上涨，在苹果蜂餐厅（Applebee's）晚餐约会是美国餐饮业最热门的门票之一。但是，一张价值 1500 美元的餐厅每周用餐的稀有通行证，却让厌倦了通货膨胀的食客们一见倾心。
item.description:
A dinner date at Applebee's is one of the hottest tickets in American dining, thanks to escalating food prices. But a rare pass for $1,500 worth of weekly meals at the restaurant became an instant hit for inflation-weary diners. https://t.co/3t4Z2RzF1u https://t.co/3t4Z2RzF1u

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 17, 2024

item.title: 自纽约市打击短租以来，纽约市的旅游环境发生了根本性的变化。纽约市 Airbnbs 上列出的短期租房数量从 8 月份的约 21500 套下降到 2 月份的约 3280 套。
item.description:
The travel landscape in New York City has changed fundamentally since its crackdown on short-term rentals. The number of short-term units listed on NYC Airbnbs dropped from about 21,500 in August to about 3,280 in February. https://t.co/30XSAqkc2G https://t.co/30XSAqkc2G

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 17, 2024

item.title: "新面貌》讲述了迪奥和香奈儿在纳粹占领下的巴黎的故事，是最近一波电影和电视节目中的最新一部，聚焦于塑造奢侈时尚的悲剧和不法行为。
item.description:
“The New Look,” about Dior and Chanel in Nazi-occupied Paris, is the latest in a recent wave of movies and television shows focused on the tragedy and wrongdoing that has shaped luxury fashion https://t.co/PAy8lXeHBD https://t.co/PAy8lXeHBD

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 17, 2024

item.title: 来自 @WSJopinion：当政客们告诉我们必须 "遵循科学 "来制定极端的气候政策时，他们实际上是在试图阻止我们讨论巨大的、不可持续的成本。我们不应该让他们得逞，@BjornLomborg 写道。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: When politicians tell us we must “follow the science” toward extreme climate policies, they are really trying to shut down the discussion of enormous, unsustainable costs. We shouldn’t let them, writes @BjornLomborg. https://t.co/xyvK621CXA

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 17, 2024

item.title: 来自 @WSJopinion：对新日铁的政治反对与经济利益无关。这与克利夫兰-克里夫斯公司、钢铁工人工会以及 11 月份蓝领工人的选举竞争有关。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: The political opposition to Nippon Steel isn’t about the economic merits. It’s about Cleveland-Cliffs, the steelworkers union and the electoral competition for blue-collar workers in November.https://t.co/IgzEBtPy17

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 17, 2024
